description: Use an Azure Virtual Network Gateway to establish secure, cross-premises connectivity.

commands.name: az network vnet-gateway create
commands.syntax:
az network vnet-gateway create --name
                               --resource-group
                               --vnet
                               [--aad-audience]
                               [--aad-issuer]
                               [--aad-tenant]
                               [--address-prefix]
                               [--allow-remote-vnet-traffic {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                               [--allow-vwan-traffic {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                               [--asn]
                               [--bgp-peering-address]
                               [--client-protocol]
                               [--custom-routes]
                               [--edge-zone]
                               [--edge-zone-vnet-id]
                               [--enable-private-ip {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                               [--gateway-default-site]
                               [--gateway-type {ExpressRoute, LocalGateway, Vpn}]
                               [--location]
                               [--max-scale-unit]
                               [--min-scale-unit]
                               [--nat-rule]
                               [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                               [--peer-weight]
                               [--public-ip-address]
                               [--radius-secret]
                               [--radius-server]
                               [--resiliency-model {MultiHomed, SingleHomed}]
                               [--root-cert-data]
                               [--root-cert-name]
                               [--sku {Basic, ErGw1AZ, ErGw2AZ, ErGw3AZ, ErGwScale, HighPerformance, Standard, UltraPerformance, VpnGw1, VpnGw1AZ, VpnGw2, VpnGw2AZ, VpnGw3, VpnGw3AZ, VpnGw4, VpnGw4AZ, VpnGw5, VpnGw5AZ}]
                               [--tags]
                               [--vpn-auth-type]
                               [--vpn-gateway-generation {Generation1, Generation2, None}]
                               [--vpn-type {PolicyBased, RouteBased}]
examples: az network vnet-gateway create -g MyResourceGroup -n MyVnetGateway --public-ip-address MyGatewayIp --vnet MyVnet --gateway-type Vpn --sku VpnGw1 --vpn-type RouteBased --no-wait

az network vnet-gateway create -g MyResourceGroup -n MyVnetGateway --public-ip-address MyGatewayIp --vnet MyVnet --gateway-type Vpn --sku VpnGw1 --vpn-type RouteBased --address-prefixes 40.1.0.0/24 --client-protocol IkeV2 SSTP --radius-secret 111_aaa --radius-server 30.1.1.15 --vpn-gateway-generation Generation1

az network vnet-gateway create -g MyResourceGroup -n MyVnetGateway --public-ip-address MyGatewayIp --vnet MyVnet --gateway-type Vpn --sku VpnGw1 --vpn-type RouteBased --address-prefixes 40.1.0.0/24 --client-protocol OpenVPN --radius-secret 111_aaa --radius-server 30.1.1.15 --aad-issuer https://sts.windows.net/00000-000000-00000-0000-000/ --aad-tenant https://login.microsoftonline.com/000 --aad-audience 0000-000 --root-cert-name root-cert --root-cert-data "root-cert.cer" --vpn-auth-type AAD Certificate Radius

az network vnet-gateway create --gateway-type Vpn --location westus2 --name MyVnetGateway --no-wait --public-ip-addresses myVGPublicIPAddress --resource-group MyResourceGroup --sku Basic --vnet MyVnet --vpn-type PolicyBased

commands.name: az network vnet-gateway delete
commands.syntax:
az network vnet-gateway delete [--ids]
                               [--name]
                               [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                               [--resource-group]
                               [--subscription]
examples: az network vnet-gateway delete -g MyResourceGroup -n MyVnetGateway

commands.name: az network vnet-gateway disconnect-vpn-connections
commands.summary: Disconnect vpn connections of virtual network gateway.
commands.syntax:
az network vnet-gateway disconnect-vpn-connections [--ids]
                                                   [--name]
                                                   [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                                   [--resource-group]
                                                   [--subscription]
                                                   [--vpn-connections]
examples: az network vnet-gateway disconnect-vpn-connections -g MyResourceGroup -n MyVnetGateway --vpn-connections MyConnetion1ByName MyConnection2ByID

commands.name: az network vnet-gateway list-advertised-routes
commands.summary: List the routes of a virtual network gateway advertised to the specified peer.
commands.syntax:
az network vnet-gateway list-advertised-routes --peer
                                               [--ids]
                                               [--name]
                                               [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                               [--resource-group]
                                               [--subscription]
examples: az network vnet-gateway list-advertised-routes -g MyResourceGroup -n MyVnetGateway --peer 23.10.10.9

commands.name: az network vnet-gateway list-bgp-peer-status
commands.summary: Retrieve the status of BGP peers.
commands.syntax:
az network vnet-gateway list-bgp-peer-status [--ids]
                                             [--name]
                                             [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                             [--peer]
                                             [--resource-group]
                                             [--subscription]
examples: az network vnet-gateway list-bgp-peer-status -g MyResourceGroup -n MyVnetGateway --peer 23.10.10.9

commands.name: az network vnet-gateway list-learned-routes
commands.summary: This operation retrieves a list of routes the virtual network gateway has learned, including routes learned from BGP peers.
commands.syntax:
az network vnet-gateway list-learned-routes [--ids]
                                            [--name]
                                            [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                            [--resource-group]
                                            [--subscription]
examples: az network vnet-gateway list-learned-routes -g MyResourceGroup -n MyVnetGateway

commands.name: az network vnet-gateway reset
commands.syntax:
az network vnet-gateway reset [--gateway-vip]
                              [--ids]
                              [--name]
                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--resource-group]
                              [--subscription]
examples: az network vnet-gateway reset -g MyResourceGroup -n MyVnetGateway
az network vnet-gateway reset -g MyResourceGroup -n MyVnetGateway --gateway-vip MyGatewayIP

commands.name: az network vnet-gateway show
commands.summary: Get the details of a virtual network gateway.
examples: az network vnet-gateway show -g MyResourceGroup -n MyVnetGateway

commands.name: az network vnet-gateway show-supported-devices
commands.summary: Get a xml format representation for supported vpn devices.
examples: az network vnet-gateway show-supported-devices -g MyResourceGroup -n MyVnetGateway

commands.name: az network vnet-gateway update
commands.syntax:
az network vnet-gateway update [--aad-audience]
                               [--aad-issuer]
                               [--aad-tenant]
                               [--add]
                               [--address-prefix]
                               [--allow-remote-vnet-traffic {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                               [--allow-vwan-traffic {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                               [--asn]
                               [--bgp-peering-address]
                               [--client-protocol]
                               [--custom-routes]
                               [--enable-bgp {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                               [--enable-private-ip {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                               [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                               [--gateway-default-site]
                               [--gateway-type {ExpressRoute, LocalGateway, Vpn}]
                               [--ids]
                               [--max-scale-unit]
                               [--min-scale-unit]
                               [--name]
                               [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                               [--peer-weight]
                               [--public-ip-address]
                               [--radius-secret]
                               [--radius-server]
                               [--remove]
                               [--resiliency-model {MultiHomed, SingleHomed}]
                               [--resource-group]
                               [--root-cert-data]
                               [--root-cert-name]
                               [--set]
                               [--sku {Basic, ErGw1AZ, ErGw2AZ, ErGw3AZ, ErGwScale, HighPerformance, Standard, UltraPerformance, VpnGw1, VpnGw1AZ, VpnGw2, VpnGw2AZ, VpnGw3, VpnGw3AZ, VpnGw4, VpnGw4AZ, VpnGw5, VpnGw5AZ}]
                               [--subscription]
                               [--tags]
                               [--vnet]
                               [--vpn-auth-type]
                               [--vpn-type {PolicyBased, RouteBased}]
examples: az network vnet-gateway update -g MyResourceGroup -n MyVnetGateway --sku VpnGw2
az network vnet-gateway update --address-prefixes 40.1.0.0/24 --client-protocol IkeV2 --name MyVnetGateway --resource-group MyResourceGroup

commands.name: az network vnet-gateway wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
